00010 #define VER_MAJOR 0
00011 #define VER_MINOR 2
00012 #define VER_REV 7
00013 
00014 typedef struct {
00015         struct initrd_fent st; //File header structure
00016         uint32 loc; //Header location
00017         uint32 mloc; //Memory location
00018         uint32 mlen; //Memory length
00019 } file_helper;
00020 
00021 file_helper* helper_list;
00022 
00023 int main(int argc, char **argv)
00024 {
00025         printf("Compiler Version %i.%i.%i\n", VER_MAJOR, VER_MINOR, VER_REV);
00026 
00027         if (argc < 2) {
00028                 printf("Error, Expected Argc greater then 2\n");
00029                 printf("Usage: Outputfile Input Input Input ...\n");    
00030                 return 0;
00031         }
00032 
00033         helper_list = malloc(sizeof(file_helper) * argc - 2);
00034         FILE * fout = 0;
00035         fout = fopen(argv[1], "wb");
00036 
00037         if (fout == 0) {
00038                 printf("Unable to open output file\n");
00039                 return 0;       
00040         }
00041 
00042         struct initial_ramdisk_header head;
00043         memset(&head, 0, sizeof(struct initial_ramdisk_header));
00044 
00045         head.ramdisk_checksum[0] = 0;
00046         head.ramdisk_checksum[1] = 0;
00047         head.ramdisk_checksum[2] = 0;
00048         head.ramdisk_checksum[3] = 0;
00049 
00050         head.ramdisk_magic = RAMMAGIC;
00051         head.ramdisk_size = sizeof(struct initial_ramdisk_header);
00052         
00053         if (fwrite(&head, sizeof(struct initial_ramdisk_header), 1, fout) != 1) {
00054                 printf("Unable to write the initial RAM disk header\n");        
00055         }
00056 
00057         uint32 nmdirs = 1;
00058         if (fwrite(&nmdirs, sizeof(uint32), 1, fout) != 1) {
00059                 printf("Unable to write Directory chunk header\n");     
00060                 return 0;
00061         }
00062 
00063         struct initrd_dirent direntry;
00064         strcpy(direntry.name, "root");
00065         direntry.dentrys = 0;
00066         direntry.fentrys = argc - 2;
00067 
00068         if (fwrite(&direntry, sizeof(struct initrd_dirent), 1, fout) != 1) {
00069                 printf("Unable to write a directory chunk\n");
00070                 return 0;       
00071         }
00072         
00073         uint32 i = 0;
00074         for (i = 0; i < direntry.fentrys; i++) {
00075                 if (fwrite(&i, sizeof(uint32), 1, fout) != 1) {
00076                         printf("Unable to write dentry fentry\n");              
00077                 }
00078         }
00079 
00080         uint32 nmfiles = argc - 2;
00081 
00082         if (fwrite(&nmfiles, sizeof(uint32), 1, fout) != 1) {
00083                 printf("Unable to write File chunk header\n");
00084                 return 0;
00085         }
00086 
00087         struct initrd_fent ent;
00088 
00089         for (i = 0; i < nmfiles; i++) {
00090 
00091                 //Strip the name from the entity
00092                 char* lastString = strrchr(argv[i + 2], '/');
00093                 if (lastString == 0)
00094                 {
00095                         printf("lastString null\n");
00096                         lastString = strchr(argv[i + 2], '\\');
00097                         if (lastString == 0)
00098                         {
00099                                 printf("lastString still null\n");
00100                                 lastString = argv[i + 2];
00101                         }
00102                         else
00103                         {
00104                                 lastString = lastString + 1;
00105                         }
00106                 } else
00107                 {
00108                         lastString = lastString + 1;
00109                 }
00110 
00111                 strcpy(ent.name, lastString);
00112 
00113                 printf("Given name %s\n", ent.name);
00114 
00115                 helper_list[i].st = ent;
00116                 helper_list[i].loc = ftell(fout);
00117                 if (fwrite(&ent, sizeof(struct initrd_fent), 1, fout) != 1) {
00118                         printf("Unable to write a file chunk\n");
00119                         return 0;       
00120                 }
00121         }
00122 
00123         FILE * fin = 0;
00124         size_t end;
00125 
00126         for (i = 0; i < nmfiles; i++) {
00127                 helper_list[i].mloc = ftell(fout) + 1;
00128                 fin = fopen(argv[i + 2], "rb");
00129                 
00130                 if (fin == 0) {
00131                         printf("Unable to open helper file\nAbort\n"); return 0;                
00132                 }
00133 
00134                 fseek(fin, 0, SEEK_END);
00135                 end = ftell(fin);
00136                 helper_list[i].mlen = end;
00137                 fseek(fin, 0, SEEK_SET);
00138                 printf("File Size (Bytes): %i\n", end);
00139 
00140                 void * mem = malloc(end);
00141                 
00142                 if (fread(mem, end, 1, fin) != 1) {
00143                         printf("Read Error\n"); return 0;               
00144                 }
00145 
00146                 if (fwrite(mem, end, 1, fout) != 1) {
00147                         printf("Write Error\n"); return 0;              
00148                 }
00149 
00150                 free(mem);
00151                 
00152                 fclose(fin);
00153         }
00154 
00155         fseek(fout, 0, SEEK_END);
00156         end = ftell(fout);
00157         fseek(fout, 0, SEEK_SET);
00158         head.ramdisk_size = end;
00159         
00160         if (fwrite(&head, sizeof(struct initial_ramdisk_header), 1, fout) != 1) {
00161                 printf("Unable to write the initial RAM disk header\n");        
00162         }       
00163 
00164         for (i = 0; i < nmfiles; i++) { //Third file pass.
00165                 fseek(fout, helper_list[i].loc, SEEK_SET); //Seek to the start of the header
00166                 helper_list[i].st.start = helper_list[i].mloc;
00167                 helper_list[i].st.size = helper_list[i].mlen;
00168 
00169                 if (fwrite(&helper_list[i].st, sizeof(struct initrd_fent), 1, fout) != 1) {
00170                         printf("Unable to write a file chunk\n");
00171                         return 0;       
00172                 }
00173         }
00174 
00175         fclose(fout);
00176 
00177         fout = fopen(argv[1], "rb");
00178         fseek(fout, sizeof(struct initial_ramdisk_header), SEEK_SET);   
00179 
00180         void* Data = malloc(end - sizeof(struct initial_ramdisk_header));
00181         size_t Read = fread(Data, end - sizeof(struct initial_ramdisk_header), 1, fout);
00182 
00183         if (Read != 1)
00184         {
00185                 printf("Error computing ramdisk hash\n");
00186                 printf("RDBYTE %i\n", Read);
00187                 return -1;
00188         }
00189 
00190         unsigned char digest[16];
00191         MDData(Data, end - sizeof(struct initial_ramdisk_header), digest);
00192 
00193         printf("Computing checksum\n");
00194 
00195         unsigned int iter = 0;
00196         for (iter = 0; iter < 16; iter++)
00197         {
00198                 printf("%x", digest[iter]);
00199                 head.ramdisk_checksum[iter] = digest[iter];
00200         }
00201 
00202         printf("\nEnd of digest\n");
00203 
00204         free(Data);
00205 
00206         fclose(fout);
00207 
00208         fout = fopen(argv[1], "r+b");
00209 
00210         if (fwrite(&head, sizeof(struct initial_ramdisk_header), 1, fout) != 1) {
00211                 printf("Unable to write the initial RAM disk header\n");        
00212         }       
00213 
00214         printf("RAM disk written. %d bytes\n", head.ramdisk_size);
00215 
00216         fclose(fout);
00217 
00218         printf("Compiled\n");
00219 
00220         return 0;
00221 }
